Continuous recognition paradigm.Definition: In the continuous recognition paradigm, study and test phases are not separate entities, but rather, items are continuously presented and the participant is instructed to respond to an item as and#34;oldand#34; if it has been seen before (generally presented a second time) in this continual stream of item presentation. Items that were correctly called and#34;oldand#34; are the subsequently remembered trials, and items that were and#34;missedand#34; (not called old upon second presentation) make up the subsequently forgotten trials.
